message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.CY, cs.CR 

This paper proposes an extension to a Delay Tolerant Network (DTN) architecture implementation to allow the dissemination of information in communities with limited access to information due to their geographic location. The paper focuses on the use of Bluetooth technology to facilitate the exchange of information and on improving data exchange in short-lived opportunistic contacts happening among nodes. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). However, the paper also discusses the use of compression mechanisms to improve data exchange, which could fall under the sub-category cs.IT (Information Theory). Additionally, the paper mentions the dissemination of educational short-video clips and audio books, which could fall under the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also discusses the use of the IBR-DTN architecture, which could fall under the sub-category cs.CY (Cryptography and Security) or cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
